metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0475 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) before 2.20 allow context-dependent attackers to bypass ForceCommand restrictions and possibly have other unspecified impact via a .. (dot dot) in a (1) LC_*, (2) LANG, or other locale environment variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> The fix for this introduced a localplt regression

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.1').
